column4: There is also the option of nxserver/client. That seems pretty compact. Anyone has good experiences with that? Anyone using freenx, besides?
freenx rocks
really? I will give it a try. On the client side, are you using nxclient or freenx client?
nomachine NX client and freenx server
client on both windows and Ubuntu machines
sweet- I've downloaded freenx_0.4.1-0alpha5_all.deb, it is safe to install that?
I installed it from backports, works fine
wow I have not yet included backpors repositories.. And I would like not to do if I can avoid it... so can I access the deb file directly somehow?
you can simply surf to the backports archive or enable backports, install freenx and disable backports
I really appreciate your help. Thank you very much!
add that parameter to the #kopt line
dma turned on?
how do I turn it on?
ubotu just told you something about dma
can I have the drive mounted or do I have to umount, hdparm and mount again?
hehe, !dma is for in this channel
HDIO_SET_DMA failed: Operation not permitted
sudo hdparm
I did sudo...
my drive refuses changing the DMA
btw, hdparm -i tells me the drive is using udma2, is that enough?
